p: Many nickel– salen complexes with free ortho and/or para positions of phenyl rings tend to undergo oxidative electropolymerization, and similar behavior could be anticipated for their N 4 analogues. Although previous research studies referred to the oxidation of [NiAmben] as irreversible at high anodic potentials [ 17], there is only one paper that describes the ability of [NiAmben] to electropolymerize onto a Pt wire under anodic polarization in a 1 M Bu 4NClO 4/CH 3CN solution [ 22]. The peculiarities of poly-[NiAmben] formation and structure–property relationships in the polymer films with respect to their potential application in energy storing and saving systems have not yet been elucidated.
